job_description:
• 3+ years of experience in operations, business intelligence, strategy, capacity planning, financial modeling, analytics, or a related field.
• Strong analytical skills with experience consolidating complex datasets across various unconnected systems and platforms to tell a clear story.
• Experience building statistical models.
• Strong interpersonal and executive presentation skills for effective partnership and long-range planning, including excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Experience presenting data in a consistent and repeatable manner to various stakeholders.
• Experience in capacity management, planning, forecasting, and scheduling is a plus.
• A related technical degree required.

• Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related STEM disciplineStrong proficiency in Python and solid knowledge of SQLHands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)Proven ability to design, train, and deploy ML/AI models in production environmentsStrong understanding of statistics, algorithms, and data structuresExcellent communication skills to explain technical concepts to business stakeholders Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)Familiarity with financial data and quantitative modelingExposure to NLP, LLMs, or reinforcement learningBackground in MLOps or experience deploying large-scale AI systems Competitive Salary: $120k - $170k (DOE)Career Growth: Pathways to senior and leadership roles in a rapidly evolving AI teamInnovation Focus: Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools shaping the finance industryFlexibility: Hybrid or on-site working options in DallasCollaborative Culture: Join a team that values creativity, forward-thinking, and impact-driven solutions.
• Design and deploy AI models: Develop and optimize machine learning and deep learning systems for financial applications.
• Build intelligent solutions: Create algorithms that automate processes, enhance risk management, and unlock actionable insights.
• Collaborate across teams: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and finance experts to integrate AI into core business platforms.
• Ensure scalability and performance: Deploy models into production environments with robust monitoring and reliability.
• Stay ahead of the curve: Research and apply emerging AI trends, from natural language processing to generative models.

• Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or related STEM fieldStrong proficiency in Python and solid knowledge of SQLExperience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)Proven ability to design, train, and deploy AI models in productionSolid understanding of statistics, algorithms, and data structuresStrong communication skills to share complex AI insights with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Competitive Salary: $100k - $140k (DOE)Career Growth: Clear pathways to senior and leadership positions as the AI team expandsImpactful Work: Shape the future of the energy industry with transformative technologyFlexibility: Hybrid or on-site options in Houston’s thriving energy hubCollaborative Culture: Join a team of innovators who are passionate about technology and sustainability Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)Background in the energy, utilities, or sustainability sectorFamiliarity with MLOps and deploying large-scale AI systemsExposure to NLP, computer vision, or reinforcement learning.
• Design and implement AI solutions: Build and deploy machine learning and deep learning models to optimize energy operations and drive innovation.
• Automate complex processes: Develop algorithms that improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance sustainability.
• Collaborate with experts: Work closely with engineers, data scientists, and product teams to integrate AI into next-generation energy systems.
• Scale intelligent systems: Ensure robust deployment of models in production environments with reliable performance and monitoring.
• Innovate continuously: Stay ahead of emerging AI trends (NLP, computer vision, generative AI) and bring new ideas to the table.
